verses.text: And the child Samuel ministered to the LORD before Eli. And the word of the LORD was precious in those days; \add there was\add* no open vision.
And it came to pass at that time, when Eli \add was\add* laid down in his place, and his eyes began to grow dim, \add that\add* he could not see;
And ere the lamp of God went out in the temple of the LORD, where the ark of God \add was\add* , and Samuel was laid down \add to sleep\add* ;
That the LORD called Samuel: and he answered, Here \add am\add* I.
And he ran to Eli, and said, Here \add am\add* I; for thou calledst me. And he said, I called not; lie down again. And he went and lay down.
And the LORD called yet again, Samuel. And Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, Here \add am\add* I; for thou didst call me. And he answered, I called not, my son; lie down again.
Now Samuel did not yet know the LORD, neither was the word of the LORD yet revealed to him.
And the LORD called Samuel again the third time. And he arose and went to Eli, and said, Here \add am\add* I; for thou didst call me. And Eli perceived that the LORD had called the child.
Therefore Eli said to Samuel, Go, lie down: and it shall be, if he should call thee, that thou shalt say, Speak, LORD; for thy servant heareth. So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
And the LORD came, and stood and called as at other times, Samuel, Samuel. Then Samuel answered, Speak; for thy servant heareth.
And the LORD said to Samuel, Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, at which both the ears of every one that heareth it shall tingle.
In that day I will perform against Eli all \add things\add* which I have spoken concerning his house: when I begin, I will also make an end.
For I have told him, that I will judge his house for ever, for the iniquity which he knoweth: because his sons made themselves vile, and he restrained them not.
And therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli's house shall not be purged with sacrifice nor offering for ever.
And Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of the LORD: and Samuel feared to show Eli the vision.
Then Eli called Samuel, and said, Samuel, my son. And he answered, Here \add am\add* I.

And he said, What \add is\add* the thing that \add the LORD\add* hath said to thee? I pray thee hide \add it\add* not from me: God do so to thee, and more also, if thou shalt hide \add any\add* thing from me, of all the things that he said to thee.
And Samuel told him every whit, and hid nothing from him. And he said, It \add is\add* the LORD: let him do what seemeth him good.
And Samuel grew, and the LORD was with him, and let none of his words fall to the ground.
And all Israel, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, knew that Samuel \add was\add* established \add to be\add* a prophet of the LORD.
And the LORD appeared again in Shiloh: for the LORD revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the LORD.
